alert.note: Alert for San Bernardino (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued September 11 at 6:44PM PDT until September 11 at 9:45PM PDT by NWS SanDiego
info.description: The National Weather Service in San Diego has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... San Bernardino County in southern California... * Until 945 PM PDT. * At 644 PM PDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 0.75 and 1.25 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.75 to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Fontana, Ontario, Rialto, Chino, I-15 Through The Cajon Pass, Rancho Cucamonga, Upland, Montclair, Devore and San Antonio Heights. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
